intro: Strobilanthes timorensis var. sexovulatus, commonly known as the Timor strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and is adapted to high humidity and partial shade. Its flowers are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure, which includes six ovary lobes, giving it its specific epithet "sexovulatus."
